metadata.title: Week 1 Day 4: Introduction to Basic Latin Grammar

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should be familiar with the Latin alphabet and basic pronunciation rules. They have been introduced to simple Latin greetings and common phrases. Understanding of basic sentence structure in English will aid in grasping Latin syntax. Familiarity with the concept of nouns and verbs in English is essential as we begin to explore these in Latin.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we covered the Latin alphabet and practiced pronunciation. Students learned simple greetings and phrases, such as 'Salve' and 'Vale'.

primary: Introduce basic Latin noun and verb forms

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet and pronunciation with a quick quiz.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will participate in a verbal quiz to recall the alphabet and pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Emphasize correct pronunciation and provide immediate feedback.

lesson_flow.description: Revisit simple greetings learned in previous lessons.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will practice greetings with a partner.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to use proper pronunciation and intonation.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce basic noun and verb forms in Latin.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on the new grammar concepts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to illustrate noun-verb agreement.

lesson_flow.description: Practice constructing simple sentences using new vocabulary and grammar.
lesson_flow.student_action: Work in pairs to create sentences and share with the class.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide sentence starters and circulate to offer help.

lesson_flow.description: Conduct a short written quiz on today's vocabulary and grammar.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Collect quizzes for review and provide feedback in the next class.

behavior.loop_behavior: Provide hints and encouragement if students struggle
